title.narrative: IR17: SCHOOL READINESS

description.narrative: IR17: Young children's school readiness improved through increased access to quality pre-school education programmes in at least 20 deprived districts, which contributes to Early Childhood Development, Early Learning, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Learning Outcomes, Skills Development. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 005 : The needs of out-of-school children aged 6-14 years, especially girls, children with special needs and OVCs are systematically assessed and addressed in disadvantaged areas in five focus regions

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: IR17: Young children's school readiness improved through increased access to quality pre-school education programmes in at least20 deprived districts

description.narrative: National Frameworks for in-service Kindergarten (KG) training and development of supplementary reading materials for early grades operationalized. KG education staff trained using the in-service framework; and 50 supplementary readers developed for early grades. KG formative assessment informed prioritization of pre-primary education in the education sector plan preparation. | Status:Met | As-of Date:21/12/2017
